long_desc.thetext:
It was reported that it may be possible to make Wireshark crash by injecting a malformed WCCP packet onto the wire or by convincing someone to read a malformed packet trace file.
Upstream bug: https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=11153
Upstream commit: https://code.wireshark.org/review/gitweb?p=wireshark.git;a=commit;h=524ed1df6e6126cd63ba419ccb82c83636d77ee4

External References:

https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2015-19.html

Statement:

This issue did not affect the versions of wireshark as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6 and 7.

Created wireshark tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1234417]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-4652 wireshark: GSM DTAP dissector crash (wnpa-sec-2015-20)

long_desc.thetext:
It was reported that it may be possible to make Wireshark crash by injecting a malformed GSM DTAP packet onto the wire or by convincing someone to read a malformed packet trace file.
Upstream bug: https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=11201
Upstream fix: https://code.wireshark.org/review/gitweb?p=wireshark.git;a=commit;h=d93be95fc0e7011e8b4ade9171e7e66146063296

External References:

https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2015-20.html

Statement:

This issue did not affect the versions of wireshark as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6, and 7.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

It was reported that Wireshark's DCOM dissector could crash. It may be possible to make Wireshark crash by injecting a malformed packet onto the wire or by convincing someone to read a malformed packet trace file.

This flaw is fixed in the following Wireshark versions: 1.12.9.

Upstream bug(s):

https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=11610

External References:

https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2015-33

Created wireshark tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1296097]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2015-8715 wireshark: AllJoyn dissector infinite loop (wnpa-sec-2015-34)

long_desc.thetext:
It was reported that Wireshark's AllJoyn dissector could loop infinitely. It may be possible to make Wireshark crash by injecting a malformed packet onto the wire or by convincing someone to read a malformed packet trace file.

This flaw is fixed in the following Wireshark versions: 1.12.9.

Upstream bug(s):

https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=11607

External References:

https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2015-34

Peter, sorry for all the bug spam. I filed all of these flaws without the CVE IDs at first since none were listed in Wireshark's advisories, not realizing MITRE assigned them. Our tools assigned one CVE per bug but updated the title here every time, sorry about that.
